entry.title: SvelteKit 1.0 - Building a Blog that fetches from RSS ðŸ¦„
entry.summary:
The aim of this post is to provide a whistle-stop tour of the latest version of SvelteKit. We're going to build a developer portfolio and blog website, that fetches data from your RSS feed, as well as the GitHub API. Contents Intro to SvelteKit What we're going to build Let's get Started!
Step #0 - Prerequisites Step #1 - Project Setup Step #2 - Finish Setup Step #3 - Components Step #4 - Creating a Route Step #5 - Special Routes Step #6 - Fetching Data Step #7 - Render Results Step #8 - Server-Side Step #9 - The Post Route Step #10 - Deploy!
The Final Project
Blog Page (fetched from RSS) Projects Page (fetched from GitHub) Social Media Links (stats fetched from APIs)
Intro to SvelteKit Svelte has pretty quickly taken the top spot for most loved web framework [SO Survey], and witâ€¦

entry.title: SvelteKit 1.0 - Building a personal blog, that shows your DEV posts ðŸ¦„
entry.summary: The aim of this post is to provide a whistle-stop tour of the latest version of SvelteKit. We're going to build a developer portfolio and blog website, that fetches data from your RSS feed, as well as the GitHub API. Contents Intro to SvelteKit What we're going to build Step #0 - Prerequisites Step #1 - Project Setup Step #2 - Finish Setup Step #3 - Components Step #4 - Creating a Route Step #5 - Special Routes Step #6 - Fetching Data Step #7 - Render Results Step #8 - Server-Side Step #9 - The Post Route Step #10 - Deploy! Blog Page (fetched from RSS) Projects Page (fetched from GitHub) Social Media Links (stats fetched from APIs) Svelte has pretty quickly taken the top spot for most loved web framework [SO Survey], and with the recent release of SvelteKit 1.0, you should expect to see deâ€¦

entry.title: Answer by Lissy93 for Differentiate between Server Side and Client Side on fetch Sapper
entry.summary:
Just an update, for SvelteKit 1.0.0 and later...

The environment module includes the browser property, which returns true if being run client-side.

For example,

import { browser } from '$app/environment';

if (browser) {
  // Running client-side
  // Can use the browser APIs here
} else {
  // Running server-side
  // Can use private env vars here
}
